summary: SSRIs are a type of medicine often used to treat sadness and worry. They work by increasing the amount of a brain chemical called serotonin, which can make people feel better. These drugs are commonly used but have side effects. Some people, especially teenagers, might not benefit as much from SSRIs, and the risks may outweigh the benefits for them. It's important to talk to a doctor to find the right treatment for each person.
title: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor
